data.title: Who Stole The Gift?
data.solution:
i=input;p=print
A="Alice";B="Bob";O=" of them";S="stole the gift"
i()
if i()[2]=="s":p(A,S);exit()
b=i()[4]=="s"
i()
if i()[2]=="s":p(B,S);exit()
p(("Neither"+O,(A,B)[b],"One"+O)[(i()[6]=="s")+b],S)
data.statement:
You've just bought a nice gift for a friend, but all of a sudden it has disappeared! You suspect your two children - {{Alice}} and {{Bob}} - of stealing the gift, since no one else was around when it happened.

Assuming no cooperation, the gift can only be stolen by <<at most one child>>. Hence, there are three logical possibilities:
(1) {{Alice}} stole the gift; {{Bob}} did not steal the gift
(2) {{Bob}} stole the gift; {{Alice}} did not steal the gift
(3) Neither {{Alice}} nor {{Bob}} stole the gift - perhaps it was misplaced

You question each child individually. If the child did not steal the gift, they will <<always tell the truth>>; their response will always be fully true. Otherwise, they <<may or may not tell the truth>>; their response could be fully true, fully false, or partially true.

Based on the limited information, can you determine who stole your gift?

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You've just bought a nice gift for a friend, but all of a sudden it has disappeared! You suspect your two children - Alice and Bob - of stealing the gift, since no one else was around when it happened.

Assuming no cooperation, the gift can only be stolen by at most one child. Hence, there are three logical possibilities:
(1) Alice stole the gift; Bob did not steal the gift
(2) Bob stole the gift; Alice did not steal the gift
(3) Neither Alice nor Bob stole the gift - perhaps it was misplaced

You question each child individually. If the child did not steal the gift, they will always tell the truth; their response will always be fully true. Otherwise, they may or may not tell the truth; their response could be fully true, fully false, or partially true.

Based on the limited information, can you determine who stole your gift?
Input
Line 1: Alice:
Line 2: Either I stole the gift or I did not steal the gift
Line 3: Either Bob stole the gift or Bob did not steal the gift
Line 4: Bob:
Line 5: Either I stole the gift or I did not steal the gift
Line 6: Either Alice stole the gift or Alice did not steal the gift
Output
Line 1: One of the following statements:
• If you are sure Alice stole the gift, output Alice stole the gift
• Else, if you are sure Bob stole the gift, output Bob stole the gift
• Else, if you are sure the gift was stolen but unsure who stole it, output One of them stole the gift
• Else, if you are not sure the gift was stolen, output Neither of them stole the gift
Constraints
None.
Example
Input
Alice:
I stole the gift
Bob did not steal the gift
Bob:
I did not steal the gift
Alice stole the gift
Output
Alice stole the gift
